title: I've been playing horribly for the past day, I don't know what's going on.
body:
I've been dying a lot more lately and I don't know why but I keep overextending and forgot about the consequences of dying.

Is this normal? Should I have a stick notes or something to remind me?

replies.body: If you're on a losing streak, chances are you're on tilt and will get more disappointed at yourself and your teammates when you die and lose. If not, you might simply be unlucky. Reduce the chances of yourself dying by doing simple things like taking awareness of the mini-map every couple of seconds and making sure you're not overextended in unwarded territory. You can also do things like valuing your life a lot more by making sure you don't trade 1 for 1 kills if you're ahead, doing whatever it takes to survive (such as flashing to dodge spells). I'd say the most important factor is improving map awareness and maintaining a good level of concentration when playing at all times.

Problem is I'm also very wary of my teammates, I try to go in when they go in a fight they're gonna lose because I think I could at least do something without getting shit on by my team.

How do I combat that?

You should probably leave them if the fight will end up being evidently unfavourable, and address to your team your concern by saying they shouldn't be picking fights if they're outnumbered. After all, it's better to have at least one alive member to defend rather than a whole dead team as they can simply take objectives without any risk. You need to communicate to them that you need to fight as 5 (or take it slow and play it out if your team is significantly behind in kills and objectives). In most cases they will acknowledge this and you will be able to engage in fair team fights, which is a lot better than not saying anything at all and being worried about your teammates losing. Confidence is also key, without it you can lose games that you actually could have won as long as you displayed confidence and competitive integrity. Also, keep in mind that some games simply can't be won, if they're too ahead or their team is simply outclassing yours in both attitude and skill.

Nah, what i do when i get on a massive losing streak is i take a massive break. Sometimes ill stop playing league for a good few days and i find that when i come back i have a fresh mind and it really helps me avoid tilting during game. Try take a break, play some other games have fun. dw about it.
i am currently going 6 Wins 36 Losses in this last week, i know your pain very well

It happens. 

A couple of days ago I went on a 6 win streak and went to bed pleased with the night's work. The next morning I looked to continue this trend and got a 7 loss streak instead. Playing the game day in and day out means it's easy to get complacent and fatigued. Even when we improve we need to realise it requires continuous effort on our part to maintain play at that level (whatever rank it is). Sometimes we have bad days too. Whatever it is, it's most important to not take it to heart. Live to fight another day and all that.
